common_issues.title: Pieces OS Integration and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with account linking, specifically linking Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Another common problem is the failure to install or open Pieces Copilot Service due to missing dependencies or sandbox restrictions. Lastly, users face difficulties installing Ollama on Linux due to the unavailability of 'curl' in the Pieces OS snap package. Solutions involve account merging, updating snap dependencies, and resolving sandbox limitations.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:
* Johnkennyuk reported an issue with the account linking flow in the Pieces app.
* The current flow is not user-friendly and needs to be replaced.

### Problems Identified:
* The account linking flow is not straightforward.
* Johnkennyuk is having trouble managing two separate accounts.
* There were bugs in earlier versions of the app that caused separate account registrations.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:
* Mark from the Pieces team offered to help John directly by merging his accounts.
* A replacement for the current account linking flow is being developed and will be deployed mid-to-late February.

### Current Status/Outcome:
* Mark has identified John's accounts and will merge them.
* John's preferred account (Google account) will be kept as the main one.
* John will need to sign out and back in again to use the merged account.

## Additional Notes:
* The issue is currently being handled directly through GitHub and email between John and Mark.
* John has expressed confidence in his ability to use the merged account despite being an IT engineer.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation Regarding Ollama Installation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama installation fails when using Pieces-OS as a snap package on Ubuntu.
* The failure is due to `curl` not being available in the snap's sandboxed environment.
* This issue affects both downloading and using pre-trained LLM models.
* Users are waiting for a solution to avoid uploading data to the cloud.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces-OS snap package does not include `curl` as a dependency.
* Ollama can't be launched or seen by Pieces-OS due to the sandbox environment.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update the snap definition file to include `curl` as a dependency.
* Allow Pieces-OS to use Ollama from within the sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A fix is being worked on and is expected to be released soon.
* Users are advised to wait for the update and avoid using pre-trained LLM models until then.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is present as of January 23, 2025.
* Users are experiencing inconvenience due to the delay in resolution.
* Concerns about data privacy and security are driving the urgency for a solution.

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Model Download Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues installing Ollama and downloading models on various operating systems, including Windows, macOS, and Linux. The problems seem to stem from sandbox environments, missing dependencies like 'curl', and potential conflicts with Pieces OS versions. Proposed solutions involve updating snap packages, resolving dependency issues, and ensuring compatibility between Pieces OS and Ollama.
